intro: Stelis gigantissima, commonly known as the giant orchid, is a striking epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 inches in diameter, often in shades of pink, white, and purple. The plant grows on trees or rocks, utilizing its aerial roots to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air. It thrives in humid, tropical environments with bright, indirect light. Due to its size and beauty, it is a popular choice for botanical gardens and specialized orchid collections.
